meanings.definition: Walk or move wearily or reluctantly.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, I was traipsing home, dragging my feet.
meanings.sent2: She traipsed through the store, not really interested in buying anything.
meanings.sent3: I found myself traipsing around the house looking for my misplaced keys.
meanings.sent4: His mind was traipsing through memories of the past, lost in nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The old man's weary figure traipsing down the road was a poignant sight.

meanings.definition: To walk or move aimlessly or idly.
meanings.sent1: The children were traipsing through the park, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent2: She spent the afternoon traipsing around the garden, lost in thought.
meanings.sent3: The cat was traipsing around the house, chasing imaginary mice.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were traipsing in circles, unable to focus on one thing.
meanings.sent5: The tourists were traipsing through the city, taking in the sights and sounds.
